results.title: Babe
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Kennedy Miller Productions, Chris Noonan, Bill Miller, Roger Ford, George Miller and Doug Mitchell
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1995
results.brief_description: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Kennedy Miller Productions, Chris Noonan, Bill Miller, Roger Ford, George Miller and Doug Mitchell
results.description: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, like Ferdinand the duck who thinks he is a rooster and Fly the dog he calls mum, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time, and Farmer Hogget knows it. With the help of the sheep dogs, Babe learns that a pig can be anything that he wants to be.
description_for_label: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, like Ferdinand the duck who thinks he is a rooster and Fly the dog he calls mum, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time, and Farmer Hogget knows it. With the help of the sheep dogs, Babe learns that a pig can be anything that he wants to be.

results.title: 13th
results.brief_description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

constellations_other.name: The world's end
constellations_other.description: For people of colour oppressed by systemic racism, genre stories about the end of the world and cosmological monsters can be used to re-examine race and the injustices faced in real life.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.
description_for_label: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

results.title: 11'09''01 - September 11
results.creator_credit: Galatée Films, CIH Shorts, Catherine Dussart Productions (CDP), Comme des Cinémas, Imamura Productions, La Générale de Production, Les Films 13, Les Films de la Plaine, MISR International Films, Makhmalbaf Film House Productions, Sequence 19 Productions, Sixteen Films, Studio Maj, StudioCanal, Zeta Film (MX), Sabrina Dhawan, Danis Tanović, Ken Loach, Nicolas Mauvernay, Paul Laverty, Jacques Perrin, Claude Lelouch, Alejandro González Iñárritu, Vladimir Vega, Sean Penn, Mira Nair, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shōhei Imamura, Samira Makhmalbaf, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Pierre Uytterhoeven, Marie-Jose Sanselme and Daisuke Tengan
results.headline_credit: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Burkina Faso, Egypt, France, India, Iran, Israel, Japan, Mexico, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
results.brief_description: Filmmakers from all over the world provide short films – each of which is eleven minutes, nine seconds, and one frame of film in length – that offer differing perspectives on the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

constellations_other.name: Post-9/11
constellations_other.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Galatée Films, CIH Shorts, Catherine Dussart Productions (CDP), Comme des Cinémas, Imamura Productions, La Générale de Production, Les Films 13, Les Films de la Plaine, MISR International Films, Makhmalbaf Film House Productions, Sequence 19 Productions, Sixteen Films, Studio Maj, StudioCanal, Zeta Film (MX), Sabrina Dhawan, Danis Tanović, Ken Loach, Nicolas Mauvernay, Paul Laverty, Jacques Perrin, Claude Lelouch, Alejandro González Iñárritu, Vladimir Vega, Sean Penn, Mira Nair, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shōhei Imamura, Samira Makhmalbaf, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Pierre Uytterhoeven, Marie-Jose Sanselme and Daisuke Tengan

results.title: [CENSORED]
results.creator_credit: Arenamedia, Chloé Brugalé and Sari Braithwaite
results.brief_description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [Censored] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.

constellations_other.name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
constellations_other.description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [Censored] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.
description_for_label: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [Censored] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.

results.title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
results.creator_credit: Kevin Feige, Charles Wood, Joss Whedon, Alexandra Byrne, Leonard F.W. Green and Marvel Studios
results.brief_description: When Tony Stark tries to jumpstart a dormant peacekeeping program, things go awry and Earth’s Mightiest Heroes are put to the ultimate test.

constellations_other.name: Superhero special effects
constellations_other.description: VFX talent isn't limited to just one studio that makes superhero blockbusters.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Kevin Feige, Charles Wood, Joss Whedon, Alexandra Byrne, Leonard F.W. Green and Marvel Studios
results.description: When Tony Stark tries to jumpstart a dormant peacekeeping program, things go awry and Earth’s Mightiest Heroes are put to the ultimate test as the fate of the planet hangs in the balance. As the villainous Ultron emerges, it is up to The Avengers to stop him from enacting his terrible plans, and soon uneasy alliances and unexpected action pave the way for an epic and unique global adventure.
description_for_label: When Tony Stark tries to jumpstart a dormant peacekeeping program, things go awry and Earth’s Mightiest Heroes are put to the ultimate test as the fate of the planet hangs in the balance. As the villainous Ultron emerges, it is up to The Avengers to stop him from enacting his terrible plans, and soon uneasy alliances and unexpected action pave the way for an epic and unique global adventure.

results.title: Australian Walkabout
results.brief_description: Australian Walkabout is a TV series made for the ABC and BBC by director Charles Chauvel. It was the last project completed by Chauvel prior to his death.
results.description: Australian Walkabout is a TV series made for the ABC and BBC by director Charles Chauvel. It was the last project completed by Chauvel prior to his death.
description_for_label: Australian Walkabout is a TV series made for the ABC and BBC by director Charles Chauvel. It was the last project completed by Chauvel prior to his death.

results.title: Attenberg
results.brief_description: Marina, 23, is growing up with her architect father by the sea. Finding the human species strange and repellent, she keeps her distance, instead observing life through the songs of Suicide, David Attenborough documentaries, and the sexual-education lessons she receives from her only friend, Bella.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs and Yorgos Lanthimos
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

results.description: Marina, 23, is growing up with her architect father in a prototype factory town by the sea. Finding the human species strange and repellent, she keeps her distance. Instead she chooses to observe it through the songs of Suicide, the mammal documentaries of Sir David Attenborough, and the sexual-education lessons she receives from her only friend, Bella. A stranger comes to town and challenges her to a foosball duel, on her own table. Her father meanwhile ritualistically prepares for his exit from the 20th century, which he considers to be “overrated.” Caught between the two men and her collaborator, Bella, Marina investigates the wondrous mystery of the human fauna.
description_for_label: Marina, 23, is growing up with her architect father in a prototype factory town by the sea. Finding the human species strange and repellent, she keeps her distance. Instead she chooses to observe it through the songs of Suicide, the mammal documentaries of Sir David Attenborough, and the sexual-education lessons she receives from her only friend, Bella. A stranger comes to town and challenges her to a foosball duel, on her own table. Her father meanwhile ritualistically prepares for his exit from the 20th century, which he considers to be “overrated.” Caught between the two men and her collaborator, Bella, Marina investigates the wondrous mystery of the human fauna.

creators_other.name: MEDIA Programme of the European Union

results.title: Assassins
results.creator_credit: Greenwich Entertainment, Tripod Media, Ryan White and Jessica Hargrave
results.brief_description: In the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, editing factual media has the ability to create doubt, shedding new light on closed cases and can even right the wrongs of the justice system.

constellations_primary.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_primary.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

constellations_primary.name: Reasonable doubt
constellations_primary.description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Greenwich Entertainment, Tripod Media, Ryan White and Jessica Hargrave
results.description: In 2017, the estranged half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was murdered in a crowded Malaysian airport. Poisoned in broad daylight, Kim Jong-nam’s death captured the world’s attention. It wasn’t just the victim’s high profile that had news desks in a flurry but the two unassuming young women at the centre of the attack. Wild stories emerged of them being highly trained North Korean spies equipped with poison lipstick while others suggested a bizarre tale of a video prank gone wrong.
description_for_label: In 2017, the estranged half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was murdered in a crowded Malaysian airport. Poisoned in broad daylight, Kim Jong-nam’s death captured the world’s attention. It wasn’t just the victim’s high profile that had news desks in a flurry but the two unassuming young women at the centre of the attack. Wild stories emerged of them being highly trained North Korean spies equipped with poison lipstick while others suggested a bizarre tale of a video prank gone wrong.

results.title: As I Open My Eyes
results.creator_credit: Ciclic - Région Centre, Ministère des Affaires Étrangères, Centre du Cinéma et de l'Audiovisuel de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles, VOO, Visions Sud Est, Hélicotronc, Blue Monday Productions, L'Aide aux Cinémas du Monde, Propaganda Production, Ministère Tunisien de la Culture, Moulin d'Andé-CECI, Emergence, Arab Fund for Arts and Culture, CNC, Anthony Rey, Imed Marzouk, Leyla Bouzid, Sandra da Fonseca, Marie-Sophie Chambon, Raouf Hiloui and Nadia Anane
results.headline_credit: Belgium, France, Tunisia and United Arab Emirates, 2015
results.brief_description: As I Open My Eyes (French: À peine j’ouvre les yeux) is a 2015 French-Tunisian drama film directed by Leyla Bouzid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ciclic - Région Centre, Ministère des Affaires Étrangères, Centre du Cinéma et de l’Audiovisuel de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles, VOO, Visions Sud Est, Hélicotronc, Blue Monday Productions, L’Aide aux Cinémas du Monde, Propaganda Production, Ministère Tunisien de la Culture, Moulin d’Andé-CECI, Emergence, Arab Fund for Arts and Culture, CNC, Anthony Rey, Imed Marzouk, Leyla Bouzid, Sandra da Fonseca, Marie-Sophie Chambon, Raouf Hiloui and Nadia Anane
results.headline_credit_for_label: Belgium, France, Tunisia and United Arab Emirates, 2015
results.description: Tunis, summer 2010, a few months before the Revolution: Farah, 18 years old, has just graduated and her family already sees her as a future doctor. But she doesn’t have the same idea. She sings in a political rock band, has a passion for life, gets drunk, discovers love and her city by night against the wishes of her mother Hayet, who knows Tunisia and its dangers all too well.
description_for_label: Tunis, summer 2010, a few months before the Revolution: Farah, 18 years old, has just graduated and her family already sees her as a future doctor. But she doesn’t have the same idea. She sings in a political rock band, has a passion for life, gets drunk, discovers love and her city by night against the wishes of her mother Hayet, who knows Tunisia and its dangers all too well.

Arab Fund for Arts and Culture

results.title: Arika A.
results.brief_description: “Even in hell, I would still paint.” Dimitris Andrianopoulos paints relentlessly. However, he refuses to sell his artwork, he doesn’t exhibit and he signs his wife’s name. On his 79th birthday he agrees to open up the door to his painting and share his art and thoughts in a documentary film. Over a period of 12 months, the camera records the microcosm of his colors and his life. The film follows his wanderings in search of answers regarding the relationship between the artist and his work, the difficulty of parting with his works, the mystery of inspiration and the unfathomable influence of the unknown
